data.title: Refactor: Adapter
data.body:
Moved graphics code from Adapter to OpenGL, moved GL code out of input. I also added a NullAdapter, which we can use for server applications and such.

@zeDoctor, I would like you specifically to review and merge this, as most of it is your code.

data.title: Feature: Editor Framework
data.body:
This adds the beginnings of an editor framework. It adds:
- Vibe-d as a dependency
- Custom WebSocket server
- Framework for sending and receiving messages
- The ability to get a callback on a response
- The ability to respond to a received message

There's still lots to do for the tools framework, including a more useful front end framework, and more engine side hooks for actually changing things. That said, this will allow game teams to start setting up actual events.

data.title: 'dub' fails in Windows command prompt
data.body:
Version: 0.9.5

Running `dub` in the Windows command prompt fails because we are using special commands that don't exist on a default Windows installation.

```
...
Running pre-build commands...
'cp' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.
'True' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.
```

data.title: Feature: Networking
data.body: The Speed networking library has been moved over to Dash. The library is located in Dash.net, and currently supports TCP connections.

data.title: Feature: SoLoud Binding
data.body: This adds a binding and libraries for us to use SoLoud as our audio engine.

data.title: Move cursor position tracking to Mouse

milestone.title: Version 1.0.0
milestone.description: At this point, Dash should be usable by a newcomer to game development who stumbles across the engine. This includes having solid documentation.

data.body: It's currently queried from Win32 directly in `Input`, which is no bueno.

data.title: Port to gfm:math from gl3n
data.body:
I think switching from [gl3n](https://github.com/Dav1dde/gl3n) to [gfm](https://github.com/d-gamedev-team/gfm) is the right move for Dash in the long run. Unfortunately, it's going to take a lot of work.

This would be a great project for an external contributor to work on, to get to know the engine. The effort has already started [here](https://github.com/Circular-Studios/Dash/tree/feature/GfmMathPort), so that would be the place to pick up from.

data.title: Added support for compiling under dmd v2.066
data.body: Also maintains compatibility with 2.065.

data.title: readme.io link in README.md leads to 404 page
data.body: The README.md mentions a readme.io page with documentation for Dash. Clicking it leads to a 404 page.

data.title: Modified the win32 window adapter ( fixes #196 )
data.body: This fixes the issue where the user is unable to move the window away from the center of the screen.

data.title: SDL Support
data.body: An SDL Adapter would help bring Dash to new platforms (most notably OSX). This would also be a great introductory task for the new engineers.

data.title: Refactor: Standalone Tests
data.body: Life is good! We can now run unittests on Travis without trying to do any weird branch syncing, extra checkouts, or any other garbage like that. This also means test results for pull requests will actually be representative of the quality of the code.

data.title: Refactor: Dash Package
data.body: This places all modules inside a global `dash` package, to avoid any namespace collisions. It also adds a `dash` module that publicly imports `dash.core`, `dash.components`, `dash.graphics`, and `dash.utility`.

data.body:
This is the first step towards supporting custom (or no) cursors in a game. We should eventually have a game script example showing how to add custom cursor graphics.

``` yaml
Display:
    Cursor: false
```

data.title: [Graphics] Fix Issues with point lights
data.body:
Because we keep forgetting these things:
- [ ] Rotate the quad so point lights work correctly for more than a view direction of 0,0,-1.
- [ ] Add special case for when the camera is inside a point light's radius.

data.title: dash-game broken dependency
data.body:
Grabbed dash-game 0.6.3 for windows, running it gives it this error:
[DEBUG]   Initializing...
dyaml.exception.YAMLException@....\Users\colde_000\AppData\Roaming\dub\packages\dyaml-master\source\dyaml\loader.d(124): Unable to open file ../Config/Config.yml for YAML loading: Cannot open or create file '../Config/Config.yml'

I could not find a place to configure the path to the file but out-of-the-box dash-game-windows doesn't work.
![dash](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1921396/3027566/17272238-e024-11e3-829f-980ec6e83206.jpg)

data.title: `core` modules could end up clashing with druntime
data.body: You're free to use `core` and `std` since these are not reserved identifiers per say, but if e.g. Druntime ever implements a `package.d` module or any other module with the same name as one of Dash'es core modules it's going to cause conflicts. It's probably better to be safe than sorry and consider renaming `core` to something else before it's too late.

data.title: Some static analysis issues
data.body:
- [x] ./utility/tasks.d(44:10)[warn]: Variable startTime is never used
- [x] ./utility/tasks.d(269:10)[warn]: Variable startTime is never used
- [x] ./utility/tasks.d(295:10)[warn]: Variable startTime is never used
- [x] ./utility/tasks.d(322:10)[warn]: Variable startTime is never used
- [x] ./core/gameobject.d(125:14)[warn]: Variable foundClassName is never used
- [x] ./core/gameobject.d(126:22)[warn]: Variable className is never used
- [x] ./components/mesh.d(162:31)[warn]: Variable w is never used
- [x] ./components/mesh.d(207:31)[warn]: Variable w is never used
- [x] ./components/mesh.d(118:36)[warn]: Variable tempBone is never used
- [x] ./components/lights.d(173:14)[warn]: Variable bias is never used
- [x] ./utility/config.d(350:9)[warn]: Implicit concatenation of string literals

I don't think that the q{} syntax is correct for GLSL code. `#version 400` is not a valid token in D so a standard-compliant lexer will reject this code. `#line` is the only valid use of the # character according to the language spec.

data.title: Dash windowed should not forcibly center
data.body:
At any size of windowed mode, Dash is forcibly centering the window. When I drag the window around it snaps back to the center.

I've taken a screenshot to highlight the effect using a small window size.

![dash-centered](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/512416/3017885/0ef8c72e-df7f-11e3-9e39-83e61e127afe.png)

data.title: [UI] UI doesn't rescale after refreshing display size
data.body: While a game is running and the Config file is refreshed, the UI stays the same size.

data.title: Feature: Animation System
data.body:
- Final group of changes for the Spring semester.
- Multiple animations supported (Multiple animations in the same file)
- Requires ObjectRefresh commit 0e30537, (Currently also requesting a merge)

data.title: Hotfix: Non-Encoded Normals
data.body:
Currently, due to edge cases in Normal Encoding, our "optimized solution" causes an interesting Pepper effect on all our objects.  This is not intended and we definitely don't want this as people start to check out the engine.

This fix causes Dash to take up a bit more GPU memory, run a bit faster, and not have broken normals.

data.title: Feature: Component Rewrite
data.body:
This pull adds better definitions for how YAML is handled.
- Anything defined in YAML that is not a component (Prefabs, Materials, etc.) have a `@yamlObject()` UDA and extend `YamlObject`, and all building and refreshing is done automatically. 
- Anything that can be added to a `GameObject` as a component must subclass `Component`, and have a `@yamlComponent()` attribute on it. If it is to be loaded, and not created when added to an object, it should specify a loader as a template parameter like this: `@yamlComponent!(q{name => Assets.get!Mesh( name )})()`. If no loader is specified, then the object is to be created. For an example of yaml component with a getter, see [Mesh](https://github.com/Circular-Studios/Dash/blob/feature/ObjectRefresh/source/components/mesh.d#L60-L61), and for one that is created, see [RotateThing in Sample-Game](https://github.com/Circular-Studios/Sample-Dash-Game/blob/feature/ObjectRefresh/Scripts/testobject.d#L39-L40).
- Each Yaml-able field should have an `@field` attribute on it. Loaders can also be specified on fields as well using the same syntax. The YAML tag can be overridden on either using a non-template function parameter (ex: `@field( "Field" )` ).
- Behaviors are no more. Scripts should now override `Component` and `YamlComponent`.

Requires #186.
